official-title.#text: To amend the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 to require certain investment advisers to pay fees to help cover the costs of inspecting and examining investment advisers under such Act.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Investment Adviser Examination Improvement Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that the
should increase the number and frequency of examinations of investment advisers.

text.#text: It is the sense of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 204 of the Investment Advisers Act of 1940

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall collect an annual fee from investment advisers that are subject to inspection or examination by the
under this title to defray the cost of such inspections and examinations.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under
by reason of

text.#text: No fees shall be collected under this subsection from any investment adviser that is prohibited from registering with the

header.#text: Exemptions for certain State-regulated investment advisers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall seek to ensure that the aggregate amount of fees collected under this subsection with respect to a specific fiscal year are equal to the estimated cost of the
in carrying out additional inspections and examinations for such fiscal year.

text.#text: The

term.#tail: means those inspections and examinations of investment advisers under this title for such fiscal year that exceed the number of inspections and examinations of investment advisers under this title conducted during fiscal year 2012.

text.#text: For purposes of this subparagraph and with respect to a fiscal year, the term
The anticipated costs of conducting inspections and examinations of investment advisers under this title, including the anticipated frequency of such inspections and examinations.
The investment adviser’s size, including the assets under management of the investment adviser.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , including registration and transaction fees.

text.#text: The number and type of clients of the investment adviser, and the extent to which the adviser’s clients pay other fees established by the
Such other objective factors, such as risk characteristics, as the Commission determines to be appropriate.

text.#text: The

determines that the formula needs to be revised, the
shall revise such formula before fees are assessed for the following fiscal year.

text.#text: Prior to the end of each fiscal year, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , without further appropriation or fiscal year limitation, to pay any costs associated with inspecting and examining investment advisers that are subject to inspection and examination under this title.

text.#text: Funds derived from fees assessed under this subsection shall be available to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , or under any other authority.

text.#text: Funds derived from fees assessed under this subsection shall not be construed to be Government or public funds or appropriated money. Notwithstanding any other provision of law, funds derived from fees assessed under this subsection shall not be subject to apportionment for the purpose of
